subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Elephant}} [[File:Elephas_maximus_(Bandipur).jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|象}} (''zō'', ''kisa''): an Asian '''[[elephant]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|ぞう|yomi=o}} {{IPAchar|/zau/}} → {{IPAchar|/zɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/zoː/}} From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=そう'|象|tr=zjangX||elephant; image, resemblance}}. Compare modern {{cog|yue|-}} reading ''zoeng6''. The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|アジア象|アジアぞう}}: [[Asian elephant]]
* {{ja-r|アフリカ象|アフリカぞう}}: [[African elephant]]
* {{ja-r|インド象|インドぞう}}: [[Indian elephant]]
* {{ja-r|象嵌|ぞうがん}}, {{ja-r|象眼|ぞうがん}}: [[inlay]]
* {{ja-r|象牙|ぞうげ}}: [[ivory]]
* {{ja-r|象牙の塔|ぞうげのとう}}: [[ivory]] [[tower]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|きさ|yomi=irr}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=きさ|-}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|橒|tr=kisa||wood grain}}, from the way that [[ivory]] also has a [[grain]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
